roleset.name: change location
roleset.note: SHIFT-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus. Member of Vncls send-11.1, calibratable_cos-45.6-1, convert-26.6.2. Updated by Julia, 11/2010. (from shift.01-v)
SHIFT-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on shift-v.01. Corresponds to Vncls send-11.1, calibratable_cos-45.6-1, convert-26.6.2. (from shift.01-n)

roles.note: arg4-attribute added based on occurance in noun corpus. (from shift.01-n)

role.descr: attribute of arg1 actually shifting (if in addition to arg1)

example.name: all args
example.text: Goldman Sachs placed the stock back on its list of recommended issues, raised its 1990 earnings estimate and recommended that its clients shift funds from Kellogg to General Mills.

example.name: ergative
example.text: Investor focus shifted quickly, traders said.

example.name: shift into high gear
example.text: Mr. Birnbaum recalls that Mr. Guber and Mr. Peters shifted into high gear a few years back...

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: One new investment style called ``asset allocation'' shifts portfolio weightings between stocks, bonds and cash when computer models say one is more attractive.
example.arg: One new investment style called ``asset allocation''
when computer models say one is more attractive

example.name: args 1-4
example.text: a production shift of several Yellow Pages directories to thefourth quarter from the third

example.name: start point/end point in a single arg- go with arg2
arg0 without arg1
example.text: But , they add that the mark 's strength is in part a reflection of a shift away from U.S. assets by Japanese investors into West German investments .

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: Khubilai's clearest signal to his Chinese subjects was his shift of the capital from Mongolia to north China.

example.name: just arg1
example.text: This marks a significant shift in the interest rate outlook
